However our projects are not J2EE projects, or rather they do not contain J2EE modules - we have implemented our own module types.   

So I guess the question is should this IResourceChangeListener be reacting to changes on our projects?  If it should, perhaps it needs to load() the adapter it is trying to use before get()ting it.

More information:

Created an attachment (id=62119)
Patch

The above patch is a simple null check and is very low risk.  This has been tested with the JUnits and adhoc testing with the UI workbench.

As for your question about whether this particular listener should be reacting to these changes even though your projects are not J2EE projects, the answer is yes.  This functionality is required for changes to VirtualComponent projects in order to keep the virtual resource trees up to date.  Though this is not relatetd to specifically to J2EE projects, because resource change listeners are expensive, it was decided to add the functionality here rather than create a new listener.
